item.title: About
item.description: Hi, I am Nadeem Jamali, a software engineer, started as a hobbyist around 2003 and never looked back! Got a Masters degree in CS with specialization in databases. Nowadays, I am more interested in search related technologies e.g Elasticsearch, Learning to Rank and Lucene search engine. However, I have been working on both front-end and the backend throughout my professional career. For more details check out my LinkedIn profile and feel free to drop me a message there!

item.title: Sorting by Search-Ranking Score: Part 1
item.description: Introduction TL;DR; This blog explains how to sort a list of strings based on a search ranking score. The calculations are explained with real world examples, implemented in Typescript and Rust. What? The search ranking score Sorting strings other than ascending or descending is not that trivial! It sucks brain blood! The search ranking score is just a floating point number! It is calculated based on the criteria that you want to use for sorting.
